0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Rotate and store food supplies.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Train new employees.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0:
# Task 1: Prepare Customs Documents - Initiate the process of preparing and submitting necessary customs documents, including commercial invoices, certificates of origin, and bill of lading, in accordance with relevant regulations and client requirements.
# Task 2: Clear Merchandise at Airports or Seaports - Coordinate with airline or shipping line staff to clear shipments through customs, ensuring all necessary paperwork is in order and compliance is met.
# Task 3: Conduct Customs Research - Analyze and interpret relevant regulations, laws, and trade agreements to ensure clients' goods are compliant with customs requirements.
# Task 4: Coordinate Freight Forwarding Services - Arrange for transportation of goods from one country to another, including selecting the most cost-effective and efficient shipping method.
# Task 5: Prepare Harmonized System (HS) Codes - Identify and assign accurate HS codes to merchandise in accordance with international trade regulations.
# Task 6: Investigate Import/Export Compliance Issues - Investigate discrepancies or non-compliance issues related to customs documentation, ensuring prompt resolution and rectification.
# Task 7: Facilitate Customs Clearance - Work closely with customs officials to expedite clearance of shipments, reducing transit times and minimizing delays.
# Task 8: Verify Country of Origin Information - Confirm the country of origin for goods, ensuring accuracy and compliance with relevant trade agreements and regulations.
# Task 9: Manage Client Relationships - Provide exceptional customer service, responding promptly to client inquiries and addressing concerns in a professional manner.
# Task 10: Ensure Compliance with Tariff Schedules - Verify that goods are accurately classified under the relevant tariff schedule, ensuring compliance with duties and taxes owed.
# Task 11: Negotiate with Customs Officials - Engage in effective communication with customs officials to resolve disputes or clarify ambiguities related to shipments.
# Task 12: Coordinate Document Submission - Ensure all required documents are submitted to customs authorities in a timely manner, including commercial invoices, bills of lading, and certificates of origin.
# Task 13: Review Shipper Documents - Verify the accuracy and completeness of shipping documents, including commercial invoices, packing lists, and certificates of origin.
# Task 14: Manage Customs Duty and Tax Calculations - Calculate duties and taxes owed on imported goods, ensuring accurate and timely payment to relevant authorities.
# Task 15: Investigate and Resolve Disputes - Investigate and resolve disputes related to customs documentation or clearance, including negotiating with suppliers or shipping lines.
# Task 16: Monitor Regulatory Changes - Stay up-to-date with changes in customs regulations, trade agreements, and laws affecting international trade.
# Task 17: Coordinate Warehouse Receipts - Arrange for warehouse receipts, ensuring accurate tracking and storage of goods prior to export.
# Task 18: Prepare Export Documents - Prepare necessary documents for exports, including commercial invoices, certificates of origin, and phytosanitary certificates.
# Task 19: Investigate Harmonized System (HS) Code Discrepancies - Identify and resolve discrepancies related to HS code assignments, ensuring accurate classification of goods.
# Task 20: Manage Import/Export Documentation - Oversee the preparation, submission, and maintenance of import and export documentation, including commercial invoices and bills of lading.
# Task 21: Analyze Customs Clearance Trends - Monitor and analyze trends in customs clearance times, identifying opportunities for process improvements and efficiency gains.
1: Develop, implement, and evaluate comprehensive training programs to enhance employee skills and performance.
Design, deliver, and manage corporate training initiatives that align with organizational goals and objectives.
Identify and assess training needs of employees, customers, or partners through various methods, including surveys and observations.
Create engaging and interactive learning experiences, such as workshops, webinars, and online courses, to capture employee attention and participation.
Coordinate and facilitate cross-functional team meetings and collaboration sessions to ensure seamless knowledge transfer and skill sharing.
Conduct needs assessments and gap analysis to determine the requirements for training programs and develop targeted interventions.
Design and implement a performance management system that includes regular training evaluations, feedback mechanisms, and coaching activities.
Collaborate with subject matter experts (SMEs) to create high-quality, up-to-date content for training materials and courses.
Develop and maintain strategic partnerships with external organizations to access best practices, expertise, and resources for training programs.
Evaluate the effectiveness of training programs through metrics such as participant feedback, knowledge retention rates, and business outcomes.
Create a knowledge management system to document, share, and retain organizational knowledge, including policies, procedures, and industry best practices.
2: Prepares ingredients for daily menu according to institutional guidelines and nutritional standards.
Serves meals in accordance with catering protocols and customer satisfaction targets.
Maintains cleanliness and organization of kitchen areas, including prep stations and dishwashing facilities.
Monitors food storage and expiration dates to ensure optimal freshness and safety.
Cooks food to precise temperatures for food safety and quality control.
Plans menus in collaboration with nutritionists to meet dietary requirements and preferences.
Safely stores leftovers and discards perishable items within designated time frames.
Restocks supplies of ingredients, linens, and cleaning materials as needed.
Collaborates with catering staff to coordinate events and functions.
Notifies management of inventory shortages or equipment malfunctions.
Fulfillments all health and safety regulations, including proper food handling practices.
Maintains accurate records of menu offerings, ingredient usage, and customer feedback for quality improvement.
